1.description: Position of lateral carina of frons

states.1: with posterior ends directed towards lateral ocelli
states.2: with posterior ends directed towards median ocellus
states.3: with posterior ends meeting anterior to ocelli forming a complete circle

2.description: Presence and shape of 2nd submarginal cell of forewing

states.2: fore and mid claws with a basal lobe

states.1: extensively striate in anterior half or more
states.2: not extensively striate, usually smooth or weakly coriarious

states.1: about as long as basitarsus, and ending in a long thin style
states.2: less that 3/4 length of fore basitarsus, and ending abruptly

states.1: Mouthparts long, galea significantly longer than wide; gena often elongate
states.2: Mouthparts short (normal), galea not longer than wide; gena not especially elongate

7.description: Frons, with or without lateral carinae

9.description: Presence of adventitious vein (2RS) on r-m crossvein of forewing

states.1: absent or indicated only by slight swelling
short, barely exerted or less than half length of metasoma
states.2: longer than half length of metasoma

12.description: Presence of RS+M vein of forewing

13.description: Presence of ventral longitudinal carinae on hind trochantellus

states.1: Hind trochantellus with one or two distinct carinae

14.description: Position of metasomal cavity (MC) (where the metasoma inserts into the mesosoma)

states.1: situated entirely dorsal to coxal cavities (CC); wide, high, straight, transverse carinae (TC) between metasomal (MC) and coxal cavities
states.2: situated partly between coxal cavities (CC); wide, high, straight, transverse carinae (TC) between metasomal (MC) and coxal cavities absent, usually curved and relatively shallow if present

15.description: Shape of lateral carina of frons

states.2: in the form of a blunt ridge, not lamellate

16.description: Presence of RS vein of forewing

states.2: present, though sometimes interrupted at midlength

states.1: present and high, resulting in a deep groove between antennae
states.2: absent or low, groove between antennae may be present but not so pronounced
